headline: Billions Co-creator Andrew Ross Sorkin on the Shows New Direction
sentences: Heilemann and Sorkin discuss the two enormous business stories dominating headlines: the stunning $44 billion acquisition of Twitter by SpaceX and Tesla CEO Elon Musk, whose roughly $275 billion net worth makes him the worlds richest person, and the Walt Disney Companys increasing embroilment in the culture wars, particularly as a whipping boy for Ron DeSantis, the Republican governor of Florida.

John Heilemann talks with Andrew Ross Sorkin, co-anchor of CNBCs Squawk Box,? columnist and assistant editor at the New York Times and founder and editor-at-large of the papers financial news franchise, DealBook, and author of the best-selling book Too Big to Fail which served as the basis for the HBO film of the same name.

They also reflect on Sorkins precocity as a young journalist at the Times, his role as co-creator of the hit Showtime series Billions, and the apparently insatiable appetite for movies and TV shows about the one percent  from Succession to WeCrashed to Super Pumped.
